Author: snefferu
Text: The bruising indicates iron deficiency, I’ve had anemia and with iron supplementation the bruises disappear (along with the extreme fatigue and fainting). I would consider upping your calories too, 1200 is a moderate/large deficit for anyone who isn’t bed bound, even at very low weights.

Author: coconutfi
Text: Taking a few steps in the right direction can make all the difference, especially by eating nutritious foods with protein, calcium and iron (plus all the other micronutrients).  I’ve had my fair share of psuedo-recoveries.  The ones I felt best were when I was eating at least close to maintenance daily.  And I didn’t workout regularly.  I was very underweight but had almost NO symptoms I normally get with heavy restriction which was crazy to me.    My guess is it’s all the working out at a decent deficit.  Ease up on the workout or increase your intake and you will notice a drastic difference.  You can reduce the symptoms while still under your TDEE.  If you’re able to from a control standpoint, I think it’s totally worth it.
